stifle.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to stop something from happening or developing
stifle.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: rules and regulations that stifle innovation
How can this party stifle debate on such a crucial issue?
stifle.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to stop a feeling from being expressed
stifle.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: He stifled an urge to hit her.
I tried to stifle my laughter.
stifle.translation[0].definitions[2].def: if you are stifled by something, it stops you breathing comfortably
stifle.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: He was almost stifled by the fumes.
I felt like I was stifling in the humid air.
stifle.translation[0].definitions[2].not: Stifle is usually passive in this meaning, when used as a transitive verb
